DataElement.preferredName: Short Physical Performance Battery 33 Time to Complete Five Stands Duration Time Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number value of the time for participant to complete five stands during repeated chair stand test.

Concepts.longName: Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 Functional Test
Concepts.definition: A standardized five-item 10-minute assessment tool, developed by Guralnik et al. 1994, that is used for the evaluation of lower extremity physical function and consists of three subtests, including standing balance, walking, and rising from a chair.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR per E. Lyalka for protocol 000359 - smt

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value with no fractional part to represent a value of seconds._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
